0 Param data.1 string m_text: I was helpless. I couldn't save them.
Kagachi, please.
I know. I can't just sit here.
Those peopleâ€”
Probably hate me. I'm the reason they're Lost and suffering.
But I have to ensure their passage. I have to do my duty as a Watcher.
I believe in you.
Is there anything I can do?
Making someone else the enemy makes you an enemy as well. You do realize that, don't you?
Please, stop...
Do you think Kagachi enjoyed doing what he did?
What made him do it? Have you thought about that?
Who failed to stem the tide of tears that threatened to flood the realm?
The sheer number of lives lost might be answer enough.
But I beg you...
Find it within yourselves to keep looking for answers. Don't give up.
Our laws were not created to restrain life.
They were written to give life hope and meaning.
I'm sure of it!
It's okay, Linne.
I have no intention of turning back now. Even if it makes me hated, and reviled.
I must fulfill my duties as a Watcher and restore hope to the realm.
Until I do, I accept the fate my sins have brought upon me.
Once we've restored hope, I'll send them on their way...
...whatever it takes.
Kagachi, look.
I need your help.
With what?
My dog. He's all alone now that I'm gone.
I just need to know that he's okay.
Could you set him free for me?
Yeah, I can do that.
Thank you.
Your owner sent me to check up on you.
So how do you want this to go, pup?
Kill the dog.
Remove chain.
You head straight for your owner, okay?
Don't get lost.
Go on, get out of here.
I hope that brings the boy peace.
Watcher Kagachi! Return to the palace at once. Lady Lobelia requests your presence.
I'm on my way.
So, are you ready to tell me what you know?
I...I wanted to turn my back on a life of want, and seek more.
Fame... Fortune...

I came from a poor home.

My father was a kind man, but a fool all the same. He never met a scheme he didn't like.

I hated that part of him.

He was the lowest of the low and, more than anything, I was ashamed of him.

Then, when I was twelve, my life changed forever.

One night my father returned home in the middle of a rainstorm. Without a word, he set his bag down and departed once more.

Inside his bag was a vast sum of money.

"Not again," I thought to myself.

I was sure he'd gotten involved in the wrong side of yet another scheme.

So that night when he returned, I murdered the pathetic man while offering him prayers for the afterlife.

I can't recall if I was happy or sad as I did it. Perhaps a little of both.

I put the money he'd brought home to great use as I climbed the ranks of society.

I lifted myself out of my own miserable existence as I worked toward serving the sovereign.

I never stopped climbing, even after working my way into the palace. I wanted to get as far away from my past as I could.

At twenty, I finally got my chance. I was selected to attend the next sovereign.

She was a girl of just eleven, yet already I could feel the hate welling up within me.

Nevertheless, I bided my time. I earned her trust and became her closest confidant.

Then I came across a certain morsel of information, and I knew the time had come to act.

I hatched a plot that would use the bloodline of the Progeny against itself.

I made up a story that the sovereign, in a brazen play for more power, was using the Night Devil to terrorize the realm.

I killed her.

I had severed the bloodline and claimed the throne for my own.
Were you satisfied?
At first, though I quickly realized I was not the chosen sovereign.
You saw it yourself. Even that infernal device underground rejected me.
I haven't felt disgrace like that since I was a poor girl living in the gutters.
Everything I'd done was in the name of self-preservation. I hadn't given thought to the importance of maintaining the bloodline.
I had been a fool.
Will the Night Devil destroy the realm?
I'm afraid he'll do worse.
The sovereign had another role I was unaware of, and by ending the bloodline, I've made that impossible.
I believe that's why the Night Devil is here. The destruction began the moment I set in motion my plot to assume the throne.
What do you mean?
Can't you hear it?
The wretched voice reverberating throughout the land?
That is this kingdom's death rattle.
We may well stop the Night Devil, but the realm is already lost.
Maybe it is.
We may not have anyone of the Progeny's blood to assume the throne, but there's nothing we can do about that now.
We need to focus on what we can do.
You're...you're right.
So what's your plan?
I haven't a clue.
Though...
If you'll allow it, I'd like to pray for the people of the realm as they cross over.
For my child, that is.
And you? Do you have a plan?
I have to deal with the Night Devil, whether I save the realm or not.
How will you manage that?
You're the only one who can save it.

Search for its origin, collect the pieces
of its malice.
You are the only one who can be bound to it.
In due course, it will find you.
I have some credible information.
I see...
Following the precepts of reincarnation has twisted the hearts of your people.
The realm as you know it may never return, and so it must be laid to rest.
For a long, long time.
Perhaps you're right.
I imagine you'll be leaving immediately.
There's no sense in waiting.
Then I should tell you this.
The Night Devil's name is Soju.
He was the sovereign's twin brother.
The sovereign had a twin?
Indeed.
He was disowned and expelled from the palace for no reason other than having shared a womb with his sister.
And I know where he went.
It's a small settlement you won't find on any map, but I'm sure it will be of great interest.
Yeah, that helps.
Keep this up and you might become a decent sovereign.
That is quite enough criticism.
May you restore the realm to its former glory and return safely, Watcher Kagachi.
There's someone over there, Kagachi. A child?
How did you get lost here? I might be able to help you if you tell me your story.
I just want out of this forest. I'm scared.
No need to be frightened. Come with us.
You mean, I can leave?
Of course. What reason is there to stay?
Finally! Wahoo!
Yes! I'm almost free!
There's so many things I want to do! And eat! Oh, there's so much I want to eat!
I'll make it happen! But first, I gotta get to town.
Kagachi, I don't think this boy realizes he's passed Beyond the Veil.
Listen... I understand how you feel, but you won't be going back to town. You're going to the next life.
You need to accept that.
What? You don't get to decide that!
I'm going back to town, and you can't stop me!
You can't do that. The dead must cross over into the next life and be reincarnated.
But I'm not dead; I'm alive. Look!
No, you're not. Youâ€”
Lalala! I can't hear you!
I'm not dead, I'm not dead!
Why would I be dead?
I'm not dead! I'M JUST NOT!
Is this how you've lingered here as a soul for so long? By rejecting your own death?
I don't wanna cross... I like being alive.
I want...to...live...
Wait! There's still time!
Look within yourself! It doesn't have to end this way!
I'm nooot deeeaaad...
I...won't...
I WOOON'T GOOO!
This is terrible!
Damn.
The least I can do is put him out of his misery.
He denied his own death and wandered, Lost, alone.
And for how long?
He never would have found happiness. You saved him, Kagachi.
At least, that's what I believe.
I'd like to think that too.
Yeah...
It's...never easy, is it?
This work we do.
And yet we're the only ones who can do it.
What do you mean?
I mean you're right. We have to save the Night Devil.
Yes...
How can the realm condone reincarnation when it gives birth to such evil as the Night Devil?
I just want some hope, Linne. Even if the kingdom is facing destruction.
And once I find it...
I'm offering that hope to you, Linne. You, who have given everything to the realm.
I swear it.
Thank you, Kagachi.
But I already have hope.
You've been my source of hope ever since we met.
So it's time I made a vow of my own: I will see this through to the bitter end with you.
I appreciate that.
In the meantime, I'll try to remember what I can.
This is where Soju came before he turned into the Night Devil.
It's pretty desolate.
What drove him to such hate?
Well, he was expelled from the realm despite being of the Progeny's bloodline.
That could be a start.
You there. How long have you lived here?
Do the names "Soju" or the "Night Devil" ring any bells?
The Night Devil... Now there is a name I haven't heard in ages.
You know of it?
Doesn't everyone?
I hear it was born right here.
It was.
He was just a boy.
But he had a fire in him. You could see it in his eyes.
And now, I must sleep.
I need some rest before they arrive.
Who's "they"?
That's not your concern.
Just one more question, then.
Do you know what caused his hatred?
The source? Hmm.
I seem to recall that he had already killed someone by the time he arrived here, but I don't really remember now.
I see.
We should have a look around.
With any luck we'll learn a bit more about the Night Devil.
Good idea!
You remember anything?
I'll keep looking, then.
Sorry.
It's okay. Take your time.
We have the Night Devil's past right here in front of us.
I'm sure we'll find something of use.
Thank you, Kagachi.
Did you hear that?! It came from the settlement!
Stay right there, son. This is our fight.
Wow!
You know, once upon a time we were the bad guys! It was so long ago now the details are fuzzy, even for me.
Only these poor souls remember us and the extent of our crimes.
They're the souls of everyone we've killed.
They can't cross beyond, and they can't fade. They're stuck here, holding an eternal grudge against us.
This life is all we've got left, and we'll spend the rest of it confronting our crimes.
I'm a Watcher. I can't just stand here and do nothing.
You're...pretty good...
But you lack conviction behind your blade.
Just like him.
Just like...the Night Devil.
Come on, stay with us!
Ahhh, what a lovely smell... Is that a flower?
Yes, a linnaea.
He always did love those. He'd pick one every day and just...stare at it.
It seemed to...calm him, somehow.
More our shock when he became the Executioner. What drove him...to such hate?
To this day...I still don't know.
You say the Night Devil liked linnaeas.
But I don't see any blooming here.
No... They haven't grown here in some time... Perhaps beyond the forest.
We'll check.
Can I...sleep now?
I'm...so very tired...
So...very...
Yes. Rest well.
He paid for his crimes on his own terms.
But this was an awful way to die.
I know.
We have to make this realm a place where these tragedies no longer happen.
Let's go.
We've got work to do.
It looks like we can get through here. Come on, Linne.
Kagachi, look! Linnaeas!
You're right.
It looks like they form a path.
Really?
Look at them. They're all planted one after another, in a line.
I think you're right!
We should follow it. There may not be anything at the end, but we can at least see how far it goes.
Sounds like a plan.
There's no such thing as a long shot at this point.
This is strange. It's almost as if Soju's calling us.
Yeah.
Will I see you again?
Yes. I promise.
You what?
Linne! What's happening!?
I...promised...
He's right.
It's all coming back, Kagachi.
Every last detail.
At last...
Linne!
Why I came to you.
Why I followed Soju.
Why I said you weren't whole.
We made a promise to each other.
Out where the linnaea flowers bloom.
We promised each other, Soju.
Soju? Wait, I'm Soju?
You were Soju before you were you. That might be the best way to think of it.
When Soju failed to reincarnate, he was split in two.
Half of him became you, in the Living World. The other half dwelled in the Beyond, an avatar of hate.
So that's why you said I wasn't whole.
No wonder I can bond with the Night Devil. The two of us used to be a single soul.
It all makes sense now.
You're what Soju aspired to become. The Night Devil is everything he wanted to leave behind.
Only your half can save his soul.
Please. You have to save Soju!
I won't have to go far. He's just up ahead, lying in wait.
I'm sorry I didn't realize it sooner.
I made you bear the weight of our past indiscretions.
I left you here to suffer, unable to cross over.
I'm sorry I'm late. But we can end this.
I can end this.
It's over, Night Devil.
Kagachi, no!
Stay back!
It's okay... I'm okay.
This is how it was meant to end.
We used to be one soul.
We belong together.
May we rest in peace.
So this timeline ends after all. I couldn't do anything to change it.
We still haven't found the one you're meant to save.
Come on, Soju. Let's go home.

Next time we'll walk the same path.

We'll find the life you wanted. One we can share.

We'll find a world that doesn't end this way.
